name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On April 24, Beijing Medical, a public account for making appointments and seeing a doctor, which is used by almost 80% of Beijing citizens and has received high praise, officially stopped service today. The public account is affiliated with the Bank of Beijing and operated by a certain Internet company. Rumors of suspension broke out in April last year, and major party media such as Observer.com Beijing Evening News followed up on the report.
Today, the official announcement was made that it was officially suspended.
As one of the few projects that facilitate the people, many netizens expressed regret

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Everyone, please be careful, the person in the picture is a scammer. I will not find anyone to send you a private message. There is no Telegram group either.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On April 24, the official website of the School of Marxism at Southeast University showed that Yuan Jiuhong, the Propaganda Minister of the Party Committee and the Dean of the School of Marxism, had been deleted from the "Current Leaders" column. 
Previously, a message about Yuan accidentally sending "pornographic photos" in a work group sparked heated discussions among netizens.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On April 24, the Shifang Municipal Public Security Bureau issued a police report stating that at around 5 p.m. on the 22nd, three people born in the 1990s rushed from other places to the depths of a local forest farm and committed suicide by taking poison.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
A middle school in Zhujiang New Town, Guangzhou, issued a notice to respond to the spirit of the document issued by the higher authorities to make a transition from "tight days" to "hard days" and reduce operating costs.
Some students said that the classroom had been out of power twice in less than a semester.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On April 23, it was reported online that a shop in Panyu District, Guangzhou, had a "corpse hidden inside the wall"
After investigation, it was found that the deceased was a male homeless person, and homicide has been ruled out. The relevant rumors are untrue.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
The long-used film textbook "History of World Cinema" (Second Edition) has been listed as a "problematic textbook" for unknown reasons.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
In response to the national "dual carbon" call, Hangzhou subway elevators took the lead in implementing an 8-hour work system.
Only open on weekdays from 6:00-10:00 and 16:00-20:00.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
I'd like to emphasize this again, and it's not just my name.
On Twitter, any strange handsome guy or beautiful girl who actively sends you a private message/shows concern or wants to help you make money is fake.
Middle-aged and elderly Twitter users should pay special attention to this.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
April 24, Kaifeng, Henan
Two men carrying sacks entered an unmanned supermarket to rob, then broke through the door and escaped.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On April 23, Chinese Ambassador to France Lu Shaye's remarks during an interview with a French TV station caused an uproar and were accused of losing control of his remarks.
According to AFP, during the interview, when asked whether Crimea belongs to Ukraine, Lu Shaye said: "Not necessarily, it depends on how we look at the issue... The issue is not that simple."
The host reminded Lu Shaye: "According to international law, Crimea belongs to Ukraine."
Lu Shaye said, "According to international law, these former Soviet countries are not substantive sovereign states because there is no international agreement to specifically define their sovereign state status."
The reporter asked: "According to you, the borders of these former Soviet countries have not been demarcated?" Lu Shaye: "Don't quibble anymore." The reporter asked, "If a piece of Chinese land is cut off by someone, someone says, don't quibble anymore..." Lu Shaye did not respond.
This incident caused a shock to the international community. On the 23rd, nearly 80 European parliamentarians jointly published an open letter in the French newspaper Le Monde, calling on French Foreign Minister Catherine Colonna to take action against Lu Shaye's "shameless attack" and announce the expulsion of Lu Shaye as soon as possible.
The open letter emphasized that Lu Shaye's speech was a bad "wolf warrior" speech, which was very inappropriate in diplomatic language and clearly violated international law. It not only seriously insulted the history, culture and national dignity of the relevant countries, but also may pose a security threat to France's European allies. France should not sit idly by.
Many governments lodged strong protests with China. Some commentators believed that Lu's remarks seriously affected the efforts brought about by the previous visit of French President Macron to China.
Afterwards, the Chinese Embassy in France issued a statement on the French version of the website, stating that Lu Shaye's remarks were only personal opinions and could not represent China's foreign policy. However, this statement was not included in the Chinese version of the embassy's website.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: In the relevant discussions on Weibo, some Chinese bloggers expressed their views on Lu Shaye.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On April 24, at the regular meeting of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the spokesperson of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs made the following response to Ambassador Lu Shaye's controversial remarks:
"China's position on the relevant issues has not changed. China respects the sovereign status of the republics after the disintegration of the Soviet Union."
"On the Ukrainian issue, China's position is clear and consistent. Some media have misinterpreted China's position on the Ukrainian issue and provoked relations between China and relevant countries. We should remain vigilant about this."
Regarding whether Ambassador Lu's remarks represent China's position and whether China is considering retracting these remarks.
The spokesperson said, "What I can tell you is that my statement just now represents the official position of the Chinese government."
